verses.verse: He said<WH559> to me,<WH1121> Son of man,<WH120> stand<WH5975> on your feet,<WH7272> and I will speak with you.<WH1696>
The Spirit<WH7307> entered<WH935> into me when he spoke<WH1696> to me,<WH5975> and set me on my feet;<WH7272> and I heard<WH8085> him who spoke to me.<WH1696>

He said<WH559> to me,<WH1121> Son of man,<WH120> I send<WH7971> you to the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> to a nation<WH1471> of rebels<WH4775> who have rebelled<WH4775> against me.<WH1> They and their fathers have transgressed<WH6586> against me even to this very<WH6106> day.<WH3117>
The children<WH1121> are impudent<WH7186> and stiff-hearted:<WH2389> I am sending<WH7971> you to them;<WH559> and you shall tell them,<WH559> Thus says the Lord<WH136> Yahweh.<WH136>

They,<WH8085> whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear,<WH2308> (for they are a rebellious<WH4805> house<WH1004>), yet shall know<WH3045> that there has been a prophet<WH5030> among them.<WH8432>

You,<WH1121> son of man,<WH120> don't<WH3372> be afraid of them,<WH3372> neither be afraid of their words,<WH1697> though briers<WH5621> and thorns<WH5544> are with you,<WH3427> and you do dwell among scorpions:<WH6137> don't<WH3372> be afraid of their words,<WH1697> nor be dismayed<WH2865> at their looks,<WH6440> though they are a rebellious<WH4805> house.<WH1004>
You shall speak<WH1696> my words<WH1697> to them,<WH8085> whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear;<WH2308> for they are most rebellious.<WH4805>

But you,<WH1121> son of man,<WH120> hear<WH8085> what I tell<WH1696> you;<WH1961> don't be rebellious<WH4805> like that rebellious<WH4805> house:<WH1004> open<WH6475> your mouth,<WH6310> and eat<WH398> that which I give you.<WH5414>
When I looked,<WH7200> behold,<WH3027> a hand was put<WH7971> forth to me;<WH4039> and, behold, a scroll of a book was therein;<WH5612>

He spread<WH6566> it before<WH6440> me:<WH3789> and it was written within<WH6440> and without;<WH268> and there were written<WH3789> therein lamentations,<WH7015> and mourning,<WH1899> and woe.<WH1958>
